main event: Multiple radar and ground observations of unidentified aerial objects in the Michigan-Wisconsin area in 1951 and 1953 were reported by military personnel.
interesting points: The objects exhibited erratic and high-speed movements, including sudden acceleration, sharp turns, and extreme speed, while sometimes appearing almost stationary.
Witnesses described the objects as round, bright, and silvery in appearance, with no sound or exhaust noted.
Weather conditions during the observations were reported to be clear, calm, and with good visibility, with no other air traffic in the area.

On 7 Sept 1951, an object was observed approaching Milwaukee, Wisconsin from the east at a high rate of speed, described as round and glowing bright orange in color, moving in a zig-zag and erratic manner.

In Colorado Springs and Dayton, Ohio, military personnel observed an unidentified aerial object that was tracked on radar and described as approximately 30 feet in diameter, circular in shape, and having a glowing exterior, rising vertically at a rapid rate of speed.
location: Michigan-Wisconsin, Colorado Springs, Colorado, Dayton, Ohio
